plants.name: Rosa chinensis
plants.description: A beloved garden rose species that blooms profusely in summer. It has fragrant, colorful flowers and is a parent to many modern roses.
plants.location: Temperate gardens worldwide, especially in Asia and temperate North America
plants.funFact: China Rose was one of the earliest rose species brought from China to Europe and greatly influenced modern rose breeding.

plants.name: Lupinus texensis
plants.description: The state flower of Texas, these wildflowers bloom in vibrant blue spikes and carpet the landscape in spring to early summer, often still visible in early July in some areas.
plants.location: South Central United States, especially Texas
plants.funFact: Bluebonnets are named after their blue petals that resemble bonnets worn by pioneer women.

plants.name: Dianthus superbus
plants.description: A wildflower with fringed, sweetly-scented pink flowers that bloom in the summer, thriving in meadows and woodlands.
plants.funFact: The fringed petals of Dianthus superbus have inspired its common name, referring to its delicate â€˜fringedâ€™ appearance.

plants.name: Eucalyptus globulus
plants.description: This fast-growing evergreen tree produces clusters of white aromatic flowers without petals. It blooms in summer and is iconic in Australian landscapes.
plants.location: Australia and cultivated worldwide in suitable climates
plants.funFact: The Blue Gum Eucalyptus is widely used for its oil and was one of the first Eucalyptus species introduced internationally.
